location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Map relating to the Final Arbitral Award Statement of Colonel A. H. McMahon, C.S.I., C.I.E., Commissioner of HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY AND EMPEROR OF INDIA; and Arbitrator of the Boundaries of Persia and Afghanistan, in Seistan; dated 1st February 1905 A.D./26th Zil Kaadeh 1322 A.H. Illustrating the entire Boundary Line from Pillar No. 52 to Pillar No. 65.'.

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: printed on paperDimensions: 640 x 560 mm on sheet 810 x 610 mmFoliation: the map has been foliated with a number written in pencil enclosed in a circle in the top right corner of the recto side of the folio.

mods.abstract: The map shows part of the boundary line between Afghanistan and Persia set by the Sistan Mission.Imprint: 'Zinco., S.I.O., Calcutta.'Distinctive features: the map is signed by George P Tate, Survey Officer [to the Sistan Mission], and Colonel A H McMahon, British Commissioner, Seistan Arbitration Commission; the map shows 'Existing Rivers'; 'Old Shelas'; 'Canals & working Shelas'; 'Boundary and pillars'; 'Old sites of villages'; and 'Naizar'.
